thread.title: People Are Pointing Out That Refugees Are Not Skittles After Donald Trump Jr. Posts Meme - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: People Are Pointing Out That Refugees Are Not Skittles After Donald Trump Jr. Posts Meme - BuzzFeed News

author: Claudia Koerner Buzzfeed News Reporter
title: People Are Pointing Out That Refugees Are Not Skittles After Donald Trump Jr. Posts Meme - BuzzFeed News
text:
Hey, DoucheBag Jr, what flavor Skittles are these Syrian refugees? #Imwithher https://t.co/LxDVd7tflQ — American Putz (@Americaputz) ID: 9646214 
People are not snakes or other animals. People are not Skittles or other foods. People are people. — Sam Sanders (@samsanders) ID: 9646220 
Even if we did bring in a few bad Skittles - and there's no evidence we do - you take that risk to save these Skitt… https://t.co/jxxMzgQXIg — Rex Huppke (@RexHuppke) ID: 9646210 
If I had a bowl of skittles and was told three of them could go to school, get educated and cure a disease, I'd absolutely take a handful. — Cristela Alonzo (@cristela9) 
@DonaldJTrumpJr This is not a skittle. — Disquiet (@disquietlycalm) ID: 9646229 9. Donald Trump has said allowing refugees into the US would put Americans at risk of more terrorist attacks. Earlier on Monday, he again called for suspending immigration from some countries. View this image › Joe Raedle / Getty Images “We should temporarily suspend immigration entering from regions where safe and adequate screening cannot occur,” Trump said. “We want people to come into our country, but they have to come legally, through a process, and we need extreme screening.” 
“This isn’t just a matter of terrorism, this is really a question of quality of life,” Trump continued. “We want to make sure we’re only admitting people into our country who love our country, we want them to love our country, and we want them to love our people.” ID: 9646250
